Author: eropple
Content: This is pretty much where I'm at. I've always rolled my eyes a bit at node.js, but a current client is using it to render SPAs and I don't think I mind that at all. For my own stuff I'd do the heavy lifting in Rails or on the JVM (depending on my needs), but I am truly sold on React/Webpack for that.

Author: steveb
Content:
Why you should care about this project: \nYou wouldn't spend months building your own Linux distribution, so why spend time reinventing the wheel with chef/puppet/ansible?

We're not building a PaaS. Like a Linux distribution, we're integrating open source building blocks (logging, service discovery, scheduling) so that you can focus on app development and analytics instead of sysadmin tasks.

I'll be giving a talk to the NYC Mesos user group this Wednesday June 17th: http://www.meetup.com/Apache-Mesos-NYC-Meetup/events/2229328...
